original_text:
If pc(t − 1) = −4 and pc(t) = 2, the real part of log(pc(t)) − log(pc(t − 1)) is negative (line slopes
down), corresponding to a decrease in absolute price. The imaginary part is 0 – π = −π,
corresponding to a change of sign from negative to positive. If the direction of the price movement is
reversed, so that pc(t − 1) = 2 and pc(t) = −4, the positive difference in the real part corresponds to
an increase in absolute price, and the positive difference in the imaginary part corresponds to a
change of sign from positive to negative.
